pr_title: add support for the Apache Dubbo

timeline.message: add dubbo plugin
add dubbo plugin(configuration and version merge)
add dubbo plugin(configuration and version merge)
use HelperClassManager to solve the ClassNotFoundException
deal with dubbo exception, for example timeout
ignore span end while not in a trace transaction
using transaction with scope to solve the concurrency problem

timeline.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText: it doesn't support multiple headers, just simple KV pair.
replies.author: CoderLan0668

replies.bodyText: And that's fine. There's no need to emulate multi-valued headers via string concatenation.
replies.author: felixbarny

timeline.author: felixbarny

timeline.bodyText: Rather than allocating an object, just pass all the information as method parameters to the helper
timeline.author: felixbarny

timeline.bodyText:
This allocates lots of objects on each invocation. In order to reduce allocations, could we go for a more simple span name to make it completely allocation free like this:
span.appendToName(apiInfo.getApiClass().getName())
    .appendToName("#")
    .appendToName(apiInfo.getMethodName());
timeline.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText: ok i will reduce the allocations
replies.author: CoderLan0668

timeline.bodyText: Could you explain what this exactly does? I fear that this is going to have too much runtime overhead.
timeline.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText:
the best pratice by dubbo, we will throw some exception that we expected, we call it as the business exception, so we don't want to let these  exceptions to be shown as error in kibana.
one way is ignoring these exception by setting the CoreConfigurations, but it's inconvenient to settings the configuration for each application， because each application has their own business exceptions, so i decide to handle it dynamically.
for performance, one exception class will only be judged whether it's business exception once, and the agent will cache the result.
replies.author: CoderLan0668

replies.bodyText:
You are already trying to capture business exceptions with custom attributes. I would still just capture a business exception just like a regular one. Then you can both see business exceptions and actual errors in the UI.
Could you make an example of when you would throw a business exception? Would one example be someone trying to order an item when there's no stock for that item? Like NoToiletPaperException?
I would argue that it's still interesting to monitor how many of these exceptions are thrown over time.
replies.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText: Are you planning to remove the biz exception concept?
replies.author: felixbarny

timeline.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText: some business exceptions are not expected to be capture as an exception, in these case,  i want to capture their as a result, and store it in custom context
replies.author: CoderLan0668

timeline.bodyText: Custom context is reserved for user-defined properties. Core agent plugins should not use them.
timeline.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText: sometimes i want to capture the arguments and return object, including exception thrown, and show them in kibana, where should i store them in?
replies.author: CoderLan0668

replies.bodyText: Would it be possible to register an interceptor that is custom to your application that adds the custom context?
replies.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText:
Like capture_body for http request, it is quite common to capture something for dubbo request，for example, the params, the data was return or the exception thrown.
The difference is the dubbo agent store these data into the custom context.
Is it proper to store these data into SpanContext or TransactionContext, like http?
replies.author: CoderLan0668

replies.bodyText:
There's currently no proper field for that. I agree that could be useful to store parameters and return values but it's not Dubbo specific. I also applies to gRPC, for example.
So I suggest leaving this out in this PR and open a follow-up discussion in https://github.com/elastic/apm instead, according to the guidelines in https://github.com/elastic/apm/blob/master/docs/agents/new-fields.md. This makes sure we align across agents and that the proposal is not Dubbo or Java specific.

or the exception thrown.

We capture the transaction via transaction.captureException now, right?
replies.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText: ok， i will remove it out of this PR
replies.author: CoderLan0668

timeline.author: felixbarny

timeline.message: modify AbstractDubboInstrumentationTest to extends AbstractInstrumentationTest, reuse some test initial codes
add support for alibaba async consumer
add support for apache dubbo async
don't support multi-valued headers via string concatenation.
reduce object allocation for performance

timeline.bodyText:
Can we make the name just "${simpleClassName}#${methodName}".
This would make it more consistent how we name transactions for other technologies like Spring MVC and JAS-RS
timeline.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText: Use java.lang.StringBuilder#append(java.lang.CharSequence, int, int) instead of Class#getSimpleClassName for that.
replies.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText: what about "${simpleClassName}#${methodName}(${parameters})", because ${parameters} is a unique part of dubbo API
replies.author: CoderLan0668

timeline.message: capture all exception thrown by dubbo invoke
skip animal.sniffer because dubbo plugin needs java 8 api.
reduce apache dubbo version to 2.7.3 which is suggested to be used in production environment
fix NoClassDefFoundError, as helper class missing
change apache dubbo version describe, just 2.7.3 and upper version
use '#' to concat the class name and method name, as SpringMVC do
use '#' to concat the class name and method name, as SpringMVC do
adjust the span name as "${simpleClassName}#${methodName}" like others do
adjust the span name as "${simpleClassName}#${methodName}" like others do
remove: capture parameters、return and exception and store into the custom context

Cleanup PR

- Reduce allocations by not wrapping callbacks
- Make plugin experimental (opt-in)
- Add @NonnullApi package-level annotations
- Use transaction.type=request, which is consistent with gRPC
- Use activate() instead of activateInScope() to reduce allocations
- Use StringBuilder.append(java.lang.CharSequence, int, int) instead of String.substring(int) to reduce allocations
Fix Javadoc link

Merge pull request #1 from felixbarny/dubbo

Cleanup PR
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' into dubbo

Another cleanup

- Use host:port for destination.service.resource
- Instrument both FutureFilter and MonitorFilter for alibaba dubbo
- Map context ResponseCallback to context because RpcContext is reset already
- Make tests more resilient by waiting for transaction

Update configuration.asciidoc

- Make Apache tests more resilient
- remove sleeps
wait for transaction in async test case
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/dubbo' into dubbo
Ensure unsupported versions are not instrumented
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' into dubbo

was previously used to track classes loaded by the canLoadClass matcher.
But nowadays, it doesn't load classes but only attempts to load the class' resource
